lines.irish: Tinn, bréan tinn na undercover cops again
lines.english: Sick, absolutely sick of the undercover cops again

lines.irish: Tinn, bréan tinn na undercover cops again
lines.english: Sick, absolutely sick of the undercover cops again

lines.irish: Tinn, bréan tinn na undercover cops again
lines.english: Sick, absolutely sick of the undercover cops again
'G 'ul tríd mo phócaí agus stocaí mar a rin' siad cheanna féin
lines.irish: Going through my pockets and socks like they already did before

lines.english: "Bain díot do chaipín agus tóg as do chain
lines.irish: "Take off your cap and empty your pockets

lines.english: Let me see your ID and empty out your change
lines.irish: Taispeáin dom do ID agus folmhaigh do mhalartán

lines.english: An bhfuil aon rud mídhleathach ort? I won't say it again
lines.irish: Do you have anything illegal on you? Ní déarfaidh mé arís é

lines.english: Má fhaighimid rud éigin, there's things that you'll have to explain."
lines.irish: If we find something, beidh ort roinnt rudaí a mhíniú.

lines.english: "Tá aithne súil agam ort, cé ' dúirt bhfuil muid roimhe
lines.irish: "I recognise you, didn’t we meet before?

lines.english: Bhí tusa sa pháirc, sé déag, ag díolú malaí luibheanna
lines.irish: You were in the park, sixteen, selling bags of weed

lines.english: In fact domh d'ainm anois, agus d'uimhir
lines.irish: In fact give me your name now, and your number

lines.english: Scumbags like you make my balls shiver"
lines.irish: Scumbags cosúil leatsa cuireann mo liathróidí ag crith

lines.english: You can call me 'Mo Chara', a local celeb i gConamara
lines.irish: Glaoigh orm 'Mo Chara', réalta áitiúil i gConamara

lines.english: "I haven't been a scumbag in years Mr Garda
lines.irish: "Níl mé i mo scumbag le blianta, a Gharda

lines.english: I just wanna have a few beer Mr Garda
lines.irish: Níl uaim ach cúpla beoir, a Gharda

lines.english: And I swear I haven't got any gear Mr Garda"
lines.irish: Agus geallaim nach bhfuil aon drugaí agam, a Gharda"

lines.english: Isteach liom, amadán, tá mo fobhríste lán
lines.irish: I walk in, eejit — my boxers are full

lines.english: Do pills, half-grams, dodgy-looking snaois bhán
lines.irish: Of pills, half grams, dodgy-looking white sniff

lines.english: Fuckin' ar bís man, fuck the police man
lines.irish: Feckin’ buzzing man, feck the police man

lines.english: Mo chara's shoving gear díreach os do ghaosán
lines.irish: Mo Chara's shoving gear straight under your nose

lines.english: Your sniffer dogs are shite
lines.irish: Tá do mhadraí sniffála ina raic

lines.english: Mate, your sniffer dogs are shite
lines.irish: A chara, tá do mhadraí sniffála ina raic

lines.english: Siúil isteach, 3CAG i mo cacht
lines.irish: Walk in, 3CAG in my stash

lines.english: Mála raithní, buidéal Bucks
lines.irish: Bag of fern, bottle of Buckfast

lines.english: Skin mór ramhar, just relax
lines.irish: Big fat skin (joint), just relax

lines.english: Seo mar atá sé, just the facts
lines.irish: That’s how it is, sin na fíricí

lines.english: Daoine óga le contacts, twenny inches when erect
lines.irish: Young lads with contacts, twenty inches when hard

lines.english: Yes, we want our country back, ach fuckin coinnigh Paddy Jack
lines.irish: Sea, ba mhaith linn ár dtír ar ais — ach coinnigh Paddy Jack

lines.english: Yes tá allas ar mo bhos, 's ní bhíomsa i mo thost
lines.irish: Sea, tá allas ar mo lámh, and I won’t stay quiet

lines.english: 's ní ghlacaim fuckin' sos, always kickin' up a fuss
lines.irish: And I don’t take a fuckin’ break — always causing a stir

lines.english: Ag na féiltí is a must, Nike Air Max agus Berghaus
lines.irish: At the festivals it’s a must — Nike Air Max and Berghaus

lines.english: Seven carat chain Argos, agus upper-cuttin' guffs
lines.irish: Seven carat chain from Argos, uppercutting eejits

lines.english: ‘Nois, ‘chóir a bheith istigh de na geataí, ach amhain some cunts acting na crá chroí
lines.irish: Now, we should be past the gates, but some eejits causing grief

lines.english: Asking for my ID and if I wanna be locked up in Maghaberry
lines.irish: Ag iarraidh mo ID agus ceistíonn siad an bhfuil mé ag iarraidh dul go Maghaberry

lines.english: S' dúirt mé "nah, tá mé maith go leor"
lines.irish: Dúirt mé, “nah, I’m grand”

lines.english: Scian sa bholg and he hit the floor
lines.irish: Knife in the belly and he dropped to the floor

lines.english: Agus ceann amhain eile agus cinnte deor
lines.irish: And another one too, and definite tears

lines.english: Ansin go leor, do you want some more?
lines.irish: That’s enough, or do you want more?

lines.english: 'Nois díreach in aice liom, tá an madadh ag tafann
lines.irish: Now right beside me, the dog is barking

lines.english: "This is the part where you stop laughing"
lines.irish: "Seo an áit ina stadann tú ag gáire"

lines.english: Scian isteach le giota beag tafainn
lines.irish: Knife in with a small stab

lines.english: No more madadh, no more sniffin'
lines.irish: Níl aon mhadadh eile, níl sniffáil ar bith

lines.english: Níos mó daoine óga ag cuir gear ina mbróga
lines.irish: More young ones hiding gear in their shoes

lines.english: "'Bhfuil stuff agat? Tá leoga"
lines.irish: "Got any stuff? For sure"

lines.english: Get wined out and do some yoga
lines.irish: Ól fíon go leor agus déan beagán yoga

lines.english: Ar dtús faigh partner a phógfá, tá mise ag fáil ró thógtha
lines.irish: First get a partner you’d kiss — I’m getting too worked up

lines.english: Could lend a score from m'athair cróga
lines.irish: Could borrow €20 from my brave oul’ fella

lines.english: But I'll leave him with it for a joint in Avoca
lines.irish: But I’ll leave him with it and roll a joint in Avoca

lines.english: Kneecap — Seo mar a bhíonn muid i gcomparáid
lines.irish: Kneecap — this is how we compare

lines.english: Kneecap — Always heard screaming "up the ra"
lines.irish: Kneecap — cloistear i gcónaí ag screadach "up the ra"

lines.english: Kneecap — Known to be head over heels i ngrá
lines.irish: Kneecap — cáiliúil mar atá i ngrá go craiceáilte

lines.english: Le drugaí linguistics agus mo ma
lines.irish: With drugs, linguistics, and my mam

lines.english: Seo thug logistics, seo mar atá
lines.irish: This brought logistics — this is how it is

lines.english: Double-dipping biscuits i mo chupán
lines.irish: Double-dipping biscuits in my cup

lines.english: Sin ag ithe picnic ag suí faoi crann
lines.irish: That’s having a picnic sitting under a tree

lines.english: Whilst getting frisky le Cumann na mBan
lines.irish: Agus ag dul craiceáilte le Cumann na mBan

lines.english: Cá bhfuil an snaois? Leaid, cá bhfuil an snaois?
lines.irish: Where's the sniff? Lads, where's the sniff?

lines.english: Táim ag teacht aníos leaid, cá bhfuil an snaois?
lines.irish: I'm coming up, lads, where’s the sniff?

lines.english: All jokin' aside lads, cá bhfuil an fucking snaois?
lines.irish: All joking aside lads — where’s the fucking sniff?
